column4: I have everything mounted on one hard drive (mounted as /) is it possible to change a directory to mount on my unused SSD drive?

you'd have to rsync the directory onto the ssd in a mount point, unmount the ssd, delete the directory you want it to replace, then mkdir the name, and then mount /dev/(whatever ssd is) /(whatever folder you want)
then you have to edit /etc/fstab to reflect your changes so it keeps it on boot
So basically copy everything over that I want mounted on the new drive, and edit fstab.. i see.
yesir. what folder are you wanting to be on the ssd?
I'm thinking /home but I'm trying to figure out which folders use up more space
look up how mount works, you might just be able to mount /dev/(ssd) /home
i know you can do that with portage temp dirs in gentoo
That seems like it would mount the contents of /dev/sd(x) onto /home instead of vice versa
yeah. i'd just move everything. the home stuff isn't system critical anyhow.
It seems /usr/ would be a fine move since most binaries are there including libraries
in all honesty, if it were me i'd do a reinstall and set up the partitioning at the beginning
:) I'm too happy with the work I've puut into this install so far :P
well, except for the mounting issue lol
mount /dev/sdb1 /mnt/ssd && rsync -avHx /home /mnt/ssd && sync;sync;sync;sync && umount /mnt/ssd && rm -rF /home && mkdir /home && mount /dev/sdb1 /home
replace the /dev/sdb1 with whatever your ssd is.
